result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Barnett Nelson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Barnett Nelson in court.  Attorney Jeffrey A Jaeger in court for David Barnett Nelson.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel's first appearance. NGI plea not supported; State and counsel in agreement.  Adj requested.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Hearing on November 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Clerk contacted SPD regarding appointment of counsel for defendant and  was notified that defendant was appointed new counsel and SPD order appointing will be filed forthwith.

Defendant David Barnett Nelson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel j Gabler Mr. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant David Barnett Nelson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel j Gabler Mr. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Doctors report has been rec'd; Defendant was represented by Attorney Leech and thought would be having SPD appoint new counsel for him.  Court adjourns and directs defendant to go to SPD after court today.  
Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Hearing on October 20, 2022 at 09:45 am.
References Examining psychologist's report filed 10/5/22
Received from Deborah L Collins, Psy. D., ABPP; confidential per Cover Sheet filed on 10/54/22
Order for Examination (NGI) to State and counsel via efile, mailed to defendant, emailed to examiner

Defendant David Barnett Nelson in court.  Attorney Gordon R Leech in court for David Barnett Nelson.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. CASES CALLED:  22CM274, 22CM391, 22CM413.  Review of competency exam; report finds def competent - State and def do not oppose findings.  Court finds def competent and orders proceedings to continue.  Counsel enters NG and NGI pleas on behalf of def; Court accepts pleas and orders NGI evaluation be completed by Dr. Collins as to all three cases.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Hearing on October 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Confidential per Cover Sheet for Confidential Records filed on 8/4/22
References Report filed on 8/4/22
Forfeiture vacated and reinstated; $1,000 bond continued; Cash bond deposited 5/2/22; No contact with LAP or SJS; No use/possession of dangerous weapons
Hearing on August 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David Barnett Nelson in court, in custody.  Attorney Gordon R Leech appeared by video for David Barnett Nelson. Defense does not have an explanation as to why he failed to appear for the 7/13 hearing; Defendant thought all of his cases were grouped together and to be heard on 8/5/2022 and wasn't aware that he had a hearing on 7/13; Court notes the hearing on 7/13 was scheduled due to defendant's failure to appear for his competency evaluation; Defendant states that he rescheduled his evaluation to this Friday and wasn't aware that he had an evaluation scheduled in June; Court has clerk contact WFU to confirm and clerk confirms that an evaluation is scheduled.  Court vacates the prior bail forf and reinstates bond, Court admonishes defendant to keep his appointments for his competency evaluation.
Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on August 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.
in custody

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David Barnett Nelson not in court.  Attorney Gordon R Leech in court for David Barnett Nelson.  Defendant has pending Br 4 cases: 22CM274 and 22CM413; Court takes note of those cases and notes they are not on the calendar for today and it s;  The reason this case was calendared was because defendant failed to appear for his comp eval; State requests warrant and Court orders same and orders the defendant admitted to DHS for report to be completed.
Hearing on July 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Letter received from Dr Niess
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Per direction of Court, HE set 6-27-22 at 1:15pm rescheduled to 8-5-22 at 11:00am per contact w/State and counsel to allow more time for competency evaluation to be completed; DA, counsel, WFU and DHS notified via email and notice sent.
Letter received from Jenna Niess, Psy.D.
Hearing on June 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Per direction of Court, HE set 5-25-22 at 9:45am rescheduled to 6-27-22 at 1:15pm to allow competency evaluation to take place; DA, counsel, WFU and DHS notified via email and notice sent.
Letter received from Wisconsin Forensic Unit
Letter received from Dr Niess

Per staff at Wisconsin Forensic Unit, they have been unable to reach defendant as he has not answered their calls and his voicemail is full.  Therefore, they are unable to submit a report at this time.  Per direction of Court, WFU advised to submit a letter prior to 5-25-22 hearing.
22R 008762 Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #15017 on 4-25-22

records.addlTxt: Defendant's
Copy to DA and counsel via efile; copy to Sheriff and Def via mail; copy emailed to DHS.
No contact with LAP or SJS, no use/possession of dangerous weapons.
Hearing on May 25, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Clerk BMC; Apprs: Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David Barnett Nelson in court in custody.  Attorney Gordon R Leech in court for David Barnett Nelson. Def request to appear in person. Case to be recalled.
Case recalled: Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Attorney Leech expects to be appointed. Court sets $1000.00 cash bond. Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the def. Counsel questions competency. Court orders competency evaluation.
Hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 09:45 am.
